incidents.name: API outage causing project downtime or slowness

incident_updates.body: We're experiencing an outage with our API and have identified the issue but some will experience downtime or slowness with projects. The team is working on a fix.
This incident has been resolved. If your editor does not load after a browser refresh, contact our Help center at help.glitch.com.
We're investigating an issue causing the editor to not load. This does not impact hosting of projects.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We have identified the issue that we believe was causing the project hosting issues, and taken measures to address the cause. We'll continue to monitor projects closely, and will mark this incident as resolved when we're confident that the issue has been fully addressed.
Glitch is currently experiencing an issue with project hosting and availability for some projects. We're currently investigating and will update with more information as we learn more.
Hosting has stabilized and returned to normal levels.

We've identified the issue and have implemented fixes that should stabilize the situation. We'll continue to monitor servers closely, and mark this incident as resolved when we're confident the fix has fully resolved the problems.
We are currently experiencing an issue with project hosting / availability. We're investigating now and will update with more information as we learn more.
Projects were improperly returning 50X errors. This incident has been resolved. If you encounter issues, you can contact support at help.glitch.com.
We have resolved the issue and logging in should should work again. If not, clear your browser cache and try again. Sorry for the trouble!
We are currently investigating an issue where the Community site and logging in is serving from a staging environment instead of production.
This incident has been resolved. If you encounter issues, you can contact support at help.glitch.com.
The API is back up, but we're continue to monitor and anticipate some slowness in connections.
We are currently investigating why our API is down, causing editor and login issues.
This incident is resolved.
A fix has been made and we are seeing custom domains connecting again as we monitor the results of the fix.
We have new reports of custom domains not connecting again and are currently investigating the issue. Only custom domains are impacted; apps can still be accessed at their glitch.me domain.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring results.  Custom domains should be connecting at this time.  If you continue to see an issue, please contact Support via our Help Center: https://help.glitch.com
We are currently investigating why some custom domains are not connecting, or connecting intermittently.
We have resolved the issue and projects are connecting again.  Thanks for your patience!
A fix is out and we are monitoring results.
We've identified the issue and are working on a fix now.
We are currently investigating why some projects are showing a connecting error in the project editor.  We will post additional updates here as we work to fix this.

incidents.name: Slow project requests and start times

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. If you continue to experience issues with your projects, email the project name to support@glitch.com and we can help you out!
A fix has been deployed and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being deployed.
We are still investigating this issue, and apologize for any inconvenience this is causing project creators.
We are still investigating this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue and are adding the Editor experience to where some users are experiencing issues.
We are currently investigating an issue where some users are experiencing slow project start times and requests.
This incident has been resolved.  Projects should be loading as expected.  If you continue to see an issue with your projects, please send us a support request here: https://help.glitch.com/new/
We are receiving reports that some apps are still not loading.  Our team is looking into this now and we will post an update here once it is resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

A fix is out and we are monitoring the results.  Apps should be able to run now, and projects should be connecting in the project editor.  If you are still seeing an issue with your apps, please send us a support request here: https://help.glitch.com/new/
The issue has been identified and we are working on a fix now.  Thanks for your patience!

We are currently investigating an issue that is preventing projects from loading.  
During this time, apps may not be running, and projects may not be connecting in the project editor.
Projects suspended in error should be running again. If your project is still not running, please send the name of the project and issue to support@glitch.com.
We are aware that some Glitch projects have been suspended in error and are working to unsuspend them. We apologize for the trouble.
This incident has been resolved.  Custom domains are now loading for Glitch projects.
Our custom domain partner believes this is a network issue and they are looking into it now.

We are investigating an issue that is preventing projects from loading at their custom domain.
Please note that visiting the glitch.me URL for these projects is still working at this time.

The issue that was preventing folks from logging in or creating an account on glitch.com has now been fixed.  

You should now be able to login again. 

If you find that you are still unable to login or create an account, please go to our Help Center at https://help.glitch.com/home/ and click Contact Support.
A fix is out and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating an issue that causes a blank, white screen to appear after attempting to login to Glitch or sign up for a Glitch account.

incidents.name: Login & Signup not working with Google or GitHub option

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix is out and we are monitoring the results.

This means that login/signup should work now.  Please give it a try!  
If you still can't login or signup, please go to our Help Center and send us a support request.
https://help.glitch.com
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We have received reports that the Email with Magic link option is not working as well.  Our team has added this to their investigation.
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing the screen to go blank after attempting to Login or Signup for Glitch while using the Google/GitHub and Magic Link options.

incidents.name: Projects with custom domains returning a 403 error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and now we're monitoring to see if this eliminates the 403 errors on custom domains.
Users are still experiencing issues with custom domains resolving, which we are still investigating and apologize for the inconvenience. Projects do work at their glitch.me domain.
We are currently investigating an issue where custom domains are returning 403 errors. Projects are still working at their glitch.me domains.

incidents.name: The project editor is not connecting when working on a static app.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The project editor should be connecting for static apps now.  We are keeping an eye on this and will move this incident to Resolved shortly.

We are rolling out a fix for this issue now.  
During this time, the live sites will continue to serve - but you may see a connecting error when opening the project editor.  
We estimate that this fix may take up to two hours to complete as we apply it to our containers.
We will update this page once the issue is resolved.
We are working to resolve an issue that is causing static apps and other apps that don't use a .env file to stop connecting.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix is out and we are monitoring the results.  Projects should not be returning Consul errors moving forward.
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing some projects to return a Consul error. Updates will be provided here as we work to resolve this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Hello, project hosting is down at the moment. During this time, projects and their live sites may not load as expected.  We are investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
API stability is returning.  We are now gradually allowing projects to start up.  During this time, requests to the editor or lives sites may be be slower than usual.
Apps are receiving traffic again.  We are now working to make sure all projects have the ability to start up as expected.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The project dashboard may be working intermittently at this time.  We are working to restore it.
Part of our infrastructure that is used for routing traffic to projects appears to be unhealthy. We are experimenting with provisioning fresh infrastructure to see if that resolves the issue.
Just wanted to drop a note here to let folks know that we are still investigating this issue.  Thanks for all your support and patience!
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
At this time, projects may not be visible when going to the live site. We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Custom domains that are connected to Glitch projects are not responding.

incident_updates.body: The issue has now been fixed.  Custom domains that are used with Glitch projects should begin connecting again.  If you still have issues with custom domains, please send a message to support@glitch.com and we will help you out!
We are currently investigating this issue.  During this time, it may not be possible to use or update a custom domain with a Glitch project.

incidents.name: Custom domains being used with Glitch projects are not connecting.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Custom domains should be working now.  If you have a custom domain that is still not responding, please send a message to support@glitch.com.
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing custom domains that are associated with Glitch projects to not work.

glitch.com should now be loading. during this time we will continue to closely monitor site performance.

This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The glitch.com website is working again.  We are continuing to investigate the cause.
Project hosting does not appear to be affected, but the community site, glitch.com is still down.
The glitch.com website and project hosting are not working at this time.  We are investigating.

incidents.name: Projects loading slowly or not loading at all.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been rolled out and we are monitoring the results.  Projects should now be loading.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are looking into why some projects are taking too long to load and/or respond.

incidents.name: Projects loading slowly or not loading at all.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Changes made to the Glitch infrastructure that are intended to improve stability of the site in the long term have had unintended and unexpected negative side effects that we have been observing since Wednesday, June 17.  

These side effects include:
- Projects loading slowly
- Projects being stuck during an npm install
- Project sync issues
- Remixes not working

We are now:
- Undoing the infrastructure changes that caused project issues
- Creating a process to prevent existing projects from being immediately affected by future work we are doing to improve the overall stability of the site.
Hey there! No real news, but we wanted to let you know that we are still here working to stabilize the system, and we thank you for checking in with us. We know this has been a long one :(

While some projects are working as expected, we are continuing to investigate the following two issues:
1. Some projects are getting stuck in “waking up” mode then stop loading after 3 minutes, making the editor inaccessible.
2. Some projects are taking longer than usual to prepare / install node modules. During this time the editor is accessible, but the public-facing app side will not fully load.
We are continuing to investigate the root cause of this issue. In the meantime, project load time appears to be improving.
We are currently looking into why some projects are loading slowly or not loading at all for some users.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The glitch website is slowly loading or gets stuck loading. Our team is investigating this now.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Remixes should now load as expected.  We are monitoring the system for reports of empty projects being created from remixes.
We are currently looking into an issue that is causing the Remix feature to either not work at all or to remix very slowly.
